repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
# Problem

LibUV doesn't find files and directories when calling `uv_fs_stat` with escaped spaces (`'\ '`).

# Solution

Unescape the file name and path before calling `uv_fs_stat`. 

Fixes #25324.

I have confirmed that the new tests failed before the changes.

comment_data.body: This is changing the value of the option itself. At least it should make a copy first.
My bad, I'm not a C developer. Didn't thought about the consequences of changing an in parameter.
`path` is never freed (that's why asan ci is failing).

backticks are not useful in a test name, it's more visually useful to use parens to indicate a function
```suggestion
  describe('using finddir()', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -129,4 +129,48 @@ describe('file search (gf, <cfile>)', function()
     test_cfile([[\\.\UNC\LOCALHOST\c$\temp\test-file.txt]], [[.]], [[\\.\UNC\LOCALHOST\c$\temp\test-file.txt]])
     test_cfile([[\\127.0.0.1\c$\temp\test-file.txt]], [[127.0.0.1]], [[\\127.0.0.1\c$\temp\test-file.txt]])
   end)
+
+  describe('using `finddir`', function()

comment_data.body:
all of these tests look pretty similar, is there a way to de-dupe the code?

it also can be noisy to have many separate it() tests for each variation of an input. when testing many inputs, all the variations can live in one test (see `test_cfile` cases above).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -129,4 +129,48 @@ describe('file search (gf, <cfile>)', function()
     test_cfile([[\\.\UNC\LOCALHOST\c$\temp\test-file.txt]], [[.]], [[\\.\UNC\LOCALHOST\c$\temp\test-file.txt]])
     test_cfile([[\\127.0.0.1\c$\temp\test-file.txt]], [[127.0.0.1]], [[\\127.0.0.1\c$\temp\test-file.txt]])
   end)
+
+  describe('using `finddir`', function()
+    it('with "\\ " on path', function()
+      local folder1 = 'folder name'
+      mkdir(folder1)
+      local folder2 = 'dir'
+      local expected_path = join_path(folder1, folder2)
+      mkdir(expected_path)
+      eq(expected_path, eval('finddir("'..folder2..'",fnameescape("'..folder1..'"))'))
+      rmdir(folder1)
+    end)
+
+    it('with "\\ " on name', function()
+      local folder1 = 'dir'
+      mkdir(folder1)
+      local folder2 = 'folder name'
+      local expected_path = join_path(folder1, folder2)
+      mkdir(expected_path)
+      eq(expected_path, eval('finddir(fnameescape("'..folder2..'"),"'..folder1..'")'))
+      rmdir(folder1)

comment_data.body:
Thanks!

I'm setting up ASAN locally to try the fix, just using `xfree` raised another error. Probably because I we reference that value on a static pointer (a wild guess from a non-C developer).

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -130,3 +130,40 @@ describe('file search (gf, <cfile>)', function()
     test_cfile([[\\127.0.0.1\c$\temp\test-file.txt]], [[127.0.0.1]], [[\\127.0.0.1\c$\temp\test-file.txt]])
   end)
 end)
+
+describe('file search with vim functions', function()
+  local test_folder = "test_folder"
+
+  setup(function()
+    mkdir(test_folder)
+  end)
+
+  teardown(function()
+    rmdir(test_folder)
+  end)
+
+  ---@param option "dir" | "file"
+  local function test_find_func(option, folder, item)
+    local folder_path = join_path(test_folder, folder)
+    mkdir(folder_path)
+    local expected = join_path(folder_path, item)
+    if option == "dir" then
+      mkdir(expected)
+    else
+      write_file(expected, '')
+    end
+    eq(expected, eval('find'..option..'(fnameescape("'..item..'"),fnameescape("'..folder_path..'"))'))
+  end
+
+  it('finddir()', function()
+    test_find_func('dir', 'directory', 'folder')
+    test_find_func('dir', 'folder name', 'directory')
+    test_find_func('dir', 'directory', 'folder name')
+  end)
+
+  it('findfile()', function()
+    test_find_func('file', 'directory', 'file.txt')
+    test_find_func('file', 'folder name', 'file.txt')
+    test_find_func('file', 'directory', 'file name.txt')
+  end)
+end)

title: fix(file_search): unescape spaces before search
